author: @mrofftopic2802
text: Another topic that was lacking in that discussion was *shadow-banning.* Dorsey wax poetic about *wanting to facilitate conversations, wanting to give users more control over their experience and being more transparent about twitter rules.* But all are undermined when his platform makes an *unilateral decision to not deliver users messages to their followers and does this unbeknownst to everyone.*

replies.author: @ActualJusticeWarrior
replies.text: They said a lot of nonsense things like they don't want to do life time bans but they have no clue how not to. It's not hard, they already do weekly, they could easily do monthly then 3 months then 6 & a year as the max for non-crimes. They just don't do that

replies.author: @mrofftopic2802
replies.text:
@ActualJusticeWarrior Yep, they were all lawyer talk and PR talk. Vijaya Gadde kept saying they don't ban people for one tweet is all about "context" aka their subjective view of your past behavior. Is clear that for Milo, Sargon and Alex Jones they would justify the ban by looking at the rules in the broadest way possible and their subjective opinion of their past behavior. But when Kathy Griffin asked for the doxxing of minors, they would only look at the offending tweet and look at rules in the most reductive way possible.

Though, I'm less concerned with bans -- life time or otherwise -- over all the shadow-baning, de-boosting, de-raking and algorithm meddling going on. At least it's public, we know who is gone. We can see the double standard and we can react accordingly. But when platforms start meddling with content delivery, we can only infer it. Hence, you have to ask your YT subscribers if they are getting your videos or not. Sargon did the same recently. It is a much worst form of differential treatment, there is no appeal, no acknowledgment, no chance of public outcry, nothing. It is a form of keeping us pacified. It is Goggle's "The Good Censor" in action.

author: @Jacob-rd2qx
text:
Though you make a good point that Rogan' s main focus isn't political, so that's why we shouldn't have expected him to be nailing Dorsy. Well then I'd say he shouldn't have had him on in the first place. But I don't think that's why he didn't grill him. He's grilled plenty of other political figures on his show. 

I heard from Gavin M. (Forget how to spell his last name but y'all know who I'm talking about) say on Crowder' s show that he'd kiss Jack dorsy' s ass because he's such a big figure and would want him back on the show. Which fervently disagree sacrifices your principles for a chance of fame. 

So Rogan didn't grill into because A) Joe isn't really a political guy. B) He didn't want to discourage dorsy from ever coming back because those podcasts would pull millions of views easily. Or C) Joe doesn't think that the censorship is that concerning and he sympathizes with Jack and his views. I really doubt it's A) i guess I'd rather it be because of reason B), but i get a feeling it's probably C).

Great analysis though mate. Love your growing channel

author: @ivrishcon-abarth38
text:
For once I agree 100%. Most times I agree to some degree. I¬¥m very happy that the deepness of Twitter "asymmetry" (I could call it something much more ugly) is chopped to pieces.

This Twitter ideology is related to the weird union of censorious lefties and censorious corporations. One of the most striking similarities, which is always rampant with communist regimes, is not accepting humor, jokes, comedy, and most of all, sarcasm. Anti-freedom of speech people, corporations, establishments always go after jokes, and these days memes. Their ideology in practise is so idiotic and incoherent, that it¬¥s excellent material to joke about. That¬¥s why everything must be taken literally, as seriously, deviously and hatefully. My old history teacher said :"The only things tyrants and dictators fear, is laughter."  I know that¬¥s not literally only thing they are afraid of, but when you have the mindset of an sjw, a smallminded tyrant, who thinks that everything that she feels insulting or just not to her liking, must be forbidden from everyone. Dictators rule by fear, say for example, Nicolae Ceaucescu in Romania during communist regime. When the fear was outed, they, Literally, killed him.

This is why the lefties (and, this would go to far right, if they were in the similar position, only it would be "national" thing, not "universal") hate comedy, jokes, memes, they show their weaknesses, stupidity and how dysfunctional their ideology or agenda is. This goes for islam, by the way, make a joke, get a bomb, authoritarian ideologies take jokes very seriously. It is said, that PEOPLE WHO LAUGH, ARE NOT AFRAID. Take away laughter, implement slaughter, and there we are, we have stalin¬¥s Soviet Union, or whatever authoritarian regime.

author: @lonewolfzor
text:
Love your content, but I really have been disturbed by your channels analytics, I think this might be due to a few things , your sound quality is kinda poor, I would suggest a lav mic to get the clear loud tone of your voice and some subtle background music (elevator style) and those blank scene cuts drive me mad, a fad to cut would be a little better but only used on a point of emphasis, or just a jump cut would be better. 

I've never really realized that your sound quality was so bad until it was in comparison to the joe Rogan podcast, I watch on a cellphone and haven't noticed but I keep my volume all the way up for your videos and turn it down when your showing other videos. So I went to my desktop and watched a video with my production grade equipment and noticed a hallway affect along with the low volume. A lav mic with a separate track recording so you can tweak the audio to rid it of ambient sounds should do the trick.  

Your content is great but the small changes to upgrade the quality of the viewing could help out for new people who find your channel, good audio keeps viewers , especially viewers for your type of content as I would bet a significant amount don't actually watch but listen while doing something else.   

I like your content and I don't wanna see your channel lose it's viewers due to production quality....

author: @SporkyMcFly
text: I think you are violating Occam's razor here and I find it worrying. You are presenting this as a malicious scheme by Twitter. As they pointed out in the podcast (and Tim really brought that point home) the bias seems very much like it is subconscious. The rule about misgendering was the perfect example to show it. They intend to reduce harm. They fail because of subconscious bias. That is the answer of Occam's razor, and the one you should stick to in my opinion.

replies.author: @PERSONAfan01
replies.text: It's clearly not. The fact is that the misgendering punishment is not just a reaction, but an ideological reaction. Misgendering is only a crime to those who are on the far left. Which falls under the accusation that Twitter is being driven by a far left ideology that covers for it's own.

replies.author: @SporkyMcFly
replies.text: @PERSONAfan01 You are making a lot of assumptions there and your story doesn't even contradict my own. That is why my narritive follows Occam's razor and yours doesn't.

replies.author: @PERSONAfan01
replies.text: @SporkyMcFly Getting some hints that you don't know what Occam's Razor means.  You say assumptions, but did you even watch that podcast, let alone the past 6 years in regards to the tech giants' biases? The lies, the bannings, their actions point to we're partial to a specific political leaning. But hey you said it. You have a specific narrative and you can't let that get in the way of it.

replies.author: @SporkyMcFly
replies.text:
@PERSONAfan01 I'm not denying the bias, you are attributing intent to the bias. That is your error and why I keep bringing up Occam's razor. It's the principle that the simplest answer is usually the correct one and tell me how you interpret these two scenarios:

1. Several tech gianst all show a specific bias that happens to coincide with the culture in which they are seated, that being Silicon Valley. These tech giants are all aware of this bias and are willfully engaging in censorship and claim they are not in favor of said censorship.
or
2. Everything is the same except their bias is subconscious, which doesn't imply nefarious intent. I'm not saying that nefarious intent is there but I would require more evidence to suppose such. What is that evidence you are harbouring?
